rComments: I don't really understand a lot of students who don't like Langille. He is an incredibly nice man. His lectures are super funny and enjoyable, if you actually pay attention. Sure, he jumps around a lot, but for those that want clear cut answers to everything - don't go to law school in the first place? Especially in a class like contracts.
teacherRatingTags: ["Skip class? You won't pass.", 'Accessible outside class', 'Caring']

rComments: Listen, he's a nice guy. But that said, he cannot teach. He cuts his sentence off half way through to jump to something else he is thinking about. The class is 1L contracts but he seems to think it is a group of experts having a chat about contracts. If it was available, don't take him as a prof. Makes the class 10000% harder than it has to be...
teacherRatingTags: ['Get ready to read', "Skip class? You won't pass.", 'Participation matters']

rComments: Langille is a very thoughtful professor. He is not ideal for those who want to be trained, not taught, at law school. You won't learn "the rule" and "how to apply it" from him. Of course, however, this is not the way real life as a lawyer works either. Taking a foundational approach, a la Langille, will make you a better lawyer, so stop whining!
